p: “Pestalachlorides A” (C21H21Cl2NO5) and “B” (C20H18Cl2O5) are chlorinated benzophenone derivatives that inhibited plant pathogenic fungi, Fusarium culmorum, Gibberella zeae, and Verticillium albo-atrum, exhibiting MIC activities of 7.2, 144.4, and 114.4 Μm respectively [ 42]. Well known compounds also include iridoide, glcopyranoside and saponin ( Figure 3).
